creator: firefox3228

title: I want to make a personal list of websites that are not dangerous, but I don't want to waste my time being directed there. How to I create this "No-Go" list?
content:
The links in every browser are going to take you (redirect) to a half-dozen places you might not even know you're being dragged to, in order to follow a given link: Think a 'news' item, that is or isn't. 99 times out of 99 you will visit advertising, also a paywall, or whatever they call it this week.

All of this is a waste of my time, which why I think about clicking on anything, knowing that it'll likely NOT be what everyone else wants you to think it is. For those times that I have my brain on remote, I want a list that I've made myself that'll take my blind clicking out of the loop before the nonsense even starts.

My own personal White List.
creator: deckard1

title: Default Profile stuck on old UI despite being updated to the latest version (Windows 11)
content:
Hi Mozilla Community,

I am running Firefox on Windows 11 and I'm encountering a strange issue regarding the UI updates.

The Issue: My Firefox browser updates automatically to the latest version. However, my Default Profile is visually stuck on the old UI design. It does not reflect the recent interface changes associated with the update.

The Troubleshooting Context:

  • I have verified that the browser itself is technically updated (via Help > About Firefox).
  • The strange part: I have other Firefox profiles on this same machine. When I launch those profiles, they correctly display the new, updated UI.
  • This issue is isolated strictly to my main/default profile.

Has anyone experienced this mismatch where the version number is correct, but the UI fails to refresh on a specific profile? Is there a specific fix for this?

Thanks in advance for the help.
creator: yashgandhi7200

title: make a temporary add-on permanent
content:
vorrei poter usare sul mio firefox portable vers 89 l'add on dark reader ma ogni versione che ho trovato non è compatibile con il mio firefox 89 qui dice che dovrebbe esserlo la Version 4.9.118 ma se provo ad installarla mi da sempre errore file danneggiato o mancante di firma quindi l'unico modo è scaricarla da qui:https://github.com/darkreader/darkreader/releases/tag/v3.5.4 spacchettarla e caricarla tutte le volte con la modalità: "debug componenti aggiuntivi" e caricare il suo file manifest.jason ma ogni volta va sempre fatta questa sequenza, la mia domanda è: c'e' un modo per rendere permanente questo add on? qui sostengono di si. https://github.com/tsaost/autoload-temporary-addon ma io ho provato e a me non funziona mi potreste aiutare? ho problemi seri alla vista e per me sarebbe vitale poter usare il dark reader con il mio firefo portable 89 sono costretto ad usare una versione pre firefox 90 perchè è l'unico modo per poter usare la mia CIE vedi bugzilla: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=2008572

grazie ancora di cuore
creator: p060477
